member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AdalTrace
member.summary: This class enables/disables tracing. To enable tracing, set TraceLevel to any level other than None which is the default

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AdalTrace.Level
member.summary: Sets/gets trace level. If set to None, it disables the logging.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AdalTraceLevel
member.summary: Trace level for logging.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AdalTraceLevel.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AdalTraceLevel.Critical
member.summary: Critical

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AdalTraceLevel.Error
member.summary: Error

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AdalTraceLevel.Warning
member.summary: Warning

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AdalTraceLevel.Informational
member.summary: Informational

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AdalTraceLevel.Verbose
member.summary: Verbose

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AdalTraceLevel.LogAlways
member.summary: LogAlways

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.StorageFileEventListener
member.summary: Code used from http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Logging-Sample-for-Windows-0b9dffd7 This is an advanced usage, where you want to intercept the logging messages and divert them somewhere besides ETW.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.StorageFileEventListener.storageFile
member.summary: Storage file to be used to write logs

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.StorageFileEventListener.name
member.summary: Name of the current event listener

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.StorageFileEventListener.format
member.summary: The format to be used by logging.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.PromptBehavior
member.summary: Indicates whether AcquireToken should automatically prompt only if necessary or whether it should prompt regardless of whether there is a cached token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.PromptBehavior.Auto
member.summary: Acquire token will prompt the user for credentials only when necessary. If a token that meets the requirements is already cached then the user will not be prompted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.PromptBehavior.Always
member.summary: The user will be prompted for credentials even if there is a token that meets the requirements already in the cache.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.PromptBehavior.Never
member.summary: The user will not be prompted for credentials. If prompting is necessary then the AcquireToken request will fail.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.PromptBehavior.RefreshSession
member.summary: Re-authorizes (through displaying webview) the resource usage, making sure that the resulting access token contains updated claims. If user logon cookies are available, the user will not be asked for credentials again and the logon dialog will dismiss automatically.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AuthorizationParameters
member.summary: Additional parameters used in acquiring user's authorization

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AuthorizationParameters.UseCorporateNetwork
member.summary: Gets or Sets flag to enable logged in user authentication. Note that enabling this flag requires some extra application capabilites. This flag only works in SSO mode and is ignored otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AuthorizationParameters.PromptBehavior
member.summary: Gets prompt behavior. If , asks service to show user the authentication page which gives them chance to authenticate as a different user.
